citeinfo.title: 1:1,000,000-Scale Congressional Districts of the United States - 114th Congress

pubinfo.publish: National Geospatial Program, The National Map Small Scale

descript.abstract: This map layer portrays the Congressional districts of the United States, Puerto Rico, and the U.S. Virgin Islands, for the 114th Congress.
descript.purpose: These data are intended for geographic display and analysis at the national level, and for large regional areas. The data should be displayed and analyzed at scales appropriate for 1:1,000,000-scale data. No responsibility is assumed by the U.S. Geological Survey in the use of these data.
descript.supplinf: Many States have more detailed Congressional district information available online; please contact the applicable State government for further information.

place.placekt: ISO 3166 Country Codes, Organization for International Standards, http://www.iso.org/iso/country_names_and_code_elements.

idinfo.useconst: None. Acknowledgment of the National Geospatial Program, The National Map Small Scale and (or) the U.S. Geological Survey would be appreciated in products derived from these data.

cntorgp.cntorg: National Geospatial Program, The National Map Small Scale

cntinfo.cntinst: For questions about this map layer or metadata, please contact The National Map Small Scale using the information above, or through the U.S. Geological Survey contact page at http://www.usgs.gov/ask/. For distribution questions, please see the Distribution Information elsewhere in this metadata.

dataqual.logic: The map layer was checked for topological consistency using ArcGIS. No other checks for logical consistency were performed on this map layer.
dataqual.complete: This map layer includes Congressional districts for the United States, Puerto Rico, and the U.S. Virgin Islands.

citeinfo.title: 1:1,000,000-Scale Congressional Districts of the United States - 113th Congress

pubinfo.publish: National Geospatial Program, The National Map Small Scale

citeinfo.title: List of freshman class members of the 114th United States Congress

procstep.procdesc: Starting with the data from CD113, the lists of Congressional representatives and senators were updated using the Freshman114, House, and Senate data sources. There are no Congressional District boundary changes between the 113th and 114th Congress. In CD113, the Hawaii second district was mapped as multiple features. Those features were merged into a single multi-part feature. The map layer was saved in shapefile and in file geodatabase formats.

enttyp.enttypd: Legislatively defined subdivisions of a State for the purpose of electing representatives or delegates to the House of Representatives of the United States Congress.
enttyp.enttypds: National Atlas of the United States

attr.attrdef: The representation of the entity in the data.
attr.attrdefs: National Atlas of the United States

attr.attrdef: The name of the State or State equivalent in which the Congressional district is located.
attr.attrdefs: National Atlas of the United States

codesetd.codesetn: American National Standards Institute (ANSI) Codes for States, the District of Columbia, Puerto Rico, and the Insular Areas of the United States

attr.attrdef: The 2-digit FIPS code of the State or State equivalent.
attr.attrdefs: National Atlas of the United States

codesetd.codesetn: American National Standards Institute (ANSI) Codes for States, the District of Columbia, Puerto Rico, and the Insular Areas of the United States

attr.attrdef: The 2-digit code of the Congressional district, identifying a district within a State. District numbers were taken from the source data; single-district States are given the number 01.
attr.attrdefs: National Atlas of the United States

edom.edomvd: The area is a district or territory which has a non-voting member in the House of Representatives.
